revised_title: Anniversary Address: Scientific Achievements and Awards in 1946
tldr: In his 1946 Anniversary Address, Sir Robert Robinson highlights the significant scientific contributions and achievements of the year, including Edgar Douglas Adrian's groundbreaking work in nerve physiology, Sir Alfred Charles Glyn Egerton's research on combustion, Sir William Lawrence Bragg's investigations of solid structures, and Dr. Cyril Dean Darlington's advancements in cytology. The Royal Society awards these scientists with prestigious medals for their work.
